attributes.action: Hold a judicial inquiry into the overseas sale of Shakespeare's Curtain Theater.
attributes.additional_details:
The Curtain Theater (The Stage Shoreditch LLP) is owned 75% by US-Controlled Cain Hoy Enterprises, 20% by UK property developer Galliard Homes and 4% by Investec Investments (South Africa, Ireland and Hong Kong). 

Ref: www.companiesintheuk.co.uk/ltd/the-stage-shoreditch

Ref: http://www.redleafpr.com/media-centre/client-news/property-pr/cain-hoy-leads-consortium-to-develop-750m-mixed-use-scheme-at-the-stage-shoreditch/

Ref: http://china.org.cn/business/2015-10/20/content_36840771.htm
attributes.background: In Nov 2014 following the 2012 discovery of Shakespeare's Curtain Theater Hackney Council sold a 250-year lease on the land that included the theater to Fairchild Place Ltd. a new company with no assets. In May 2015 control of Fairchild Place Ltd. was transferred to American and Chinese investors.

rejection.details: It's not clear what you want the inquiry to look into. In any case, this seems to be the responsibility of Hackney Council, not the Government or Parliament.
